Modding the Shell and In-Game UI

Basic Explanation

MODding the shell is a little tricky.  You need to know the name of the screen you are MODding so you can replace it properly.  The Sample MOD has an example of updating the Main Menu.

Modding the Main Menu

In the MOD SDK we have provided a default Main Menu screen located in the Default UI Screens\MainMenu folder.  This contains all the files you will need to update the Main Menu screen.  The Sample MOD simply updates the art files to reskin the MainMenu.

Data Structure

In your MODs data folder you will need a folder named AptUI.  In this folder you can copy over the MainMenu files from the Default UI Screens folder.  There should be a sub folder named MainMenu with all the Menu files in it.  In the AptUI folder you will need an XML file that includes the MainMenu.xml.  This is a bit redundant, but is necessary to get the proper directory structure in the big file that will be generated when you build your MOD.

<Include type="all" source="DATA:SampleMod/Data/AptUI/MainMenu/MainMenu.xml" />

You will also need to include your MainMenu.xml in your Mod.xml file. The Include entry should look like this:

<Include type="reference" source="DATA:SampleMod/Data/AptUI/MainMenu.xml" />

This xml file will then include the MainMenu.xml that is located in the MainMenu folder on the disk.  The directory structure for this is very important any errors in structure will cause the MOD to not function.  You can now just replace whatever textures you wish as long as they have the same name as the file you are replacing.
